line_2: And Thou, unhappy Child, She said

line_1: He bade the kindling flames to be allay'd.
line_2: Soon selfish fears his coward heart dismay'd,

line_1: He bade the kindling flames to be allay'd.
line_2: With voice confus'd, unknowing what he said,

line_1: Alas! should beauty be to woe allay'd?
line_2: Content should never wander from her side;

line_1: Alas! should beauty be to woe allay'd?
line_2: Good luck, I pray to heav'n, the face that's fair betide.

line_1: Their fury quell'd, and martial rage allay'd,
line_2: I wait our heroes in the sylvan shade:

line_1: No more the summer in thy glooms allay'd,
line_2: Thy evening breezes, and thy noon-day shade.

line_1: Essence divine, with lifeless clay allay'd,
line_2: By double nature, double instinct sway'd;

line_1: Hast every grief and pain allay'd,
line_2: Thou, Goddess! since, with sacred aid,

line_1: By thee be all my woes allay'd;
line_2: And, if I right invoke thy aid,

line_1: To sooth your Cares! — by every Grief allay'd!
line_2: And O! by every Charm his Art essay'd
